sections.title: Alchemist, Confusion Bomb: Should this discovery require a saving throw?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Alchemist, Confusion Bomb: Should this discovery require a saving throw?
sections.description:
Yes. The target of the bomb may attempt at a save against the confusion effect (Will negates, using the bomb's DC).

This will be corrected in the...

sections.title: Alchemist, Tentacle/Vestigial Arm: What does "extra attacks" mean for these discoveries?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Alchemist, Tentacle/Vestigial Arm: What does "extra attacks" mean for these discoveries?
sections.description:
It means "extra," as in "more than you would be able to make if you didn't have that discovery."

For example, if you're low-level alchemist who us...

sections.title: Archetypes and Gaining Powers: If an archetype like wildblooded sorcerer grants new class features like bloodline powers, domain powers, or the like, if I don’t have that archetype, can I use feats like Eldritch Heritage or Believer’s Boon and choose the powers granted by the archetype.
sections.anchor_heading: ## Archetypes and Gaining Powers: If an archetype like wildblooded sorcerer grants new class features like bloodline powers, domain powers, or the like, if I don’t have that archetype, can I use feats like Eldritch Heritage or Believer’s Boon and choose the powers granted by the archetype.
sections.description: No. These powers only exist for the archetypes that grant them. This is particularly important because in some cases, the archetype might trade out...

sections.title: Druid: For the giant beetle companion (page 36), what should the 4th-level advanced beetle's bite damage be?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Druid: For the giant beetle companion (page 36), what should the 4th-level advanced beetle's bite damage be?
sections.description:
The damage should be 1d8.

Update: Page 36, Beetle, Giant, change the 4th-level advancement bite damage to "1d8."

sections.anchor_heading: ## Magus,Black Blade: Can I use Craft Magic Arms and Armor to increase my blade's enhancement bonus?
sections.description: No, nor can you use that feat to add other properties (such asflaming) to theblack blade. You can use your arcane pool to temporarily add abilities...

sections.title: Magus: Can a magus use spell combat (page 10) with cantrips?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Magus: Can a magus use spell combat (page 10) with cantrips?
sections.description: Yes. It is not limited to spells of level 1 or higher.

sections.title: Magus: Can a magus use spellstrike (page 10) to cast a touch spell, move, and make a melee attack with a weapon to deliver the touch spell, all in the same round?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Magus: Can a magus use spellstrike (page 10) to cast a touch spell, move, and make a melee attack with a weapon to deliver the touch spell, all in the same round?
sections.description: Yes. Other than deploying the spell with a melee weapon attack instead of a melee touch attack, the magus spellstrike ability doesn’t change the no...

sections.title: Magus: When using spell combat, can the weapon in my other hand be an unarmed strike or a natural weapon?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Magus: When using spell combat, can the weapon in my other hand be an unarmed strike or a natural weapon?
sections.description: Yes, so long as the weapon is a light or one-handed melee weapon and is associated with that hand. For example, unarmed strikes, claws, and slams a...

sections.title: Magus, Spell Combat: When using spell combat, do I specifically have to use the weapon in my other hand, or can I use a mixture of weapons (such as armor spikes and bites) so long as my casting hand remains free?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Magus, Spell Combat: When using spell combat, do I specifically have to use the weapon in my other hand, or can I use a mixture of weapons (such as armor spikes and bites) so long as my casting hand remains free?
sections.description: You specifically have to use the light or one-handed melee weapon in your other hand.

sections.title: Magus, Spell Combat: Does spell combat count as making a full attack action for the purpose ofhasteand other effects?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Magus, Spell Combat: Does spell combat count as making a full attack action for the purpose ofhasteand other effects?
sections.description:
Yes.

Edit 9/9/13: This is a revised ruling about howhasteinteracts with effects that are essentially a full attack, even though the creature isn't...

sections.title: Magus, Spell Combat: If I use spell combat, how many weapon attacks can I make?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Magus, Spell Combat: If I use spell combat, how many weapon attacks can I make?
sections.description: You can make as many weapon attacks as you would normally be able to make if you were making a full attack with that weapon. For example, if you ar...

sections.title: Monk: Can a qinggong monk take a second archetype if the character doesn't swap out abilities the second archetype requires?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Monk: Can a qinggong monk take a second archetype if the character doesn't swap out abilities the second archetype requires?
sections.description: Yes. However, the other archetype takes priority over the various abilities granted at each level, and the character can't delay taking an ability...

sections.anchor_heading: ## Oracle: For the metal mystery's iron weapon revelation (page 55) and wood mystery's wooden weapon revelation (page 58), how long does the created weapon last?

sections.description: The sage sorcerer uses her Int to determine the number of daily uses of her bloodline powers, including arcane bolt. Therefore, whether arcane bolt...

sections.title: Summoner: Can a synthesist (page 80) make attacks from his own body (such as manufactured weapons, unarmed strikes, or natural attacks) and attacks from the fused eidolon in the same round?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Summoner: Can a synthesist (page 80) make attacks from his own body (such as manufactured weapons, unarmed strikes, or natural attacks) and attacks from the fused eidolon in the same round?
sections.description: Yes, but the fused character's natural attacks are still subject to the Maximum Attacks entry in the table for an eidolon of his level. For example...

sections.title: Summoner: Can a synthesist (page 80) benefit from the Skilled evolution even though his eidolon doesn't have skills of its own? What about the Ability Score Increase evolution applied to a mental ability score?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Summoner: Can a synthesist (page 80) benefit from the Skilled evolution even though his eidolon doesn't have skills of its own? What about the Ability Score Increase evolution applied to a mental ability score?
sections.description:
If the synthesist's eidolon has the Skilled evolution, the synthesist gains the bonus to that skill.

If the synthesist applies the Increased Abili...

sections.title: Summoner: Can a synthesist (page 80) use spells on himself that don't affect outsiders, even though he is treated as his own type or the outsider type, "whichever is worse"?

sections.title: Summoner: Can a synthesist (page 80) use the aspect ability to apply the improved natural armor evolution to himself? Will this stack with the improved natural armor of the eidolon-suit?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Summoner: Can a synthesist (page 80) use the aspect ability to apply the improved natural armor evolution to himself? Will this stack with the improved natural armor of the eidolon-suit?
sections.description: A synthesist can use aspect to increase his own natural armor. However, when fused, he gains the eidolon's natural armor bonus, so this doesn't sta...

sections.title: Summoner: Does a synthesist (page 80) keep any armor bonuses or other benefits from his armor when he is fused with his eidolon?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Summoner: Does a synthesist (page 80) keep any armor bonuses or other benefits from his armor when he is fused with his eidolon?
sections.description: No. The eidolon is, in effect, the synthesist's armor, and any armor the synthesist wears does not function while the eidolon is present. Fortunate...

sections.title: Summoner: Does a synthesist (page 80) use his own Hit Dice or his eidolon's Hit Dice for evolutions based on Hit Dice, such as Breath Weapon and Web? What about his BAB for making attacks?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Summoner: Does a synthesist (page 80) use his own Hit Dice or his eidolon's Hit Dice for evolutions based on Hit Dice, such as Breath Weapon and Web? What about his BAB for making attacks?
sections.description:
The synthesist uses the eidolon's Hit Dice for the effects of evolutions, not his summoner Hit Dice or his total Hit Dice.

When fused, use the eid...

sections.title: Summoner: How does a synthesist (page 80) heal damage to his eidolon?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Summoner: How does a synthesist (page 80) heal damage to his eidolon?
sections.description: Because the eidolon gives the synthesist temporary hit points rather than having a separate pool of normal hit points, effects that cure hit points...

sections.title: Summoner: If a synthesist (page 80) takes the swallow whole evolution, does he use his own hp or the eidolon's temporary hp to determine the hp of the "stomach"?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Summoner: If a synthesist (page 80) takes the swallow whole evolution, does he use his own hp or the eidolon's temporary hp to determine the hp of the "stomach"?
sections.description: Use the summoner's hp to determine this. Obviously the summoner isn't actually swallowing the target, so it's merely contained within the eidolon-s...

sections.title: Summoner: What happens when a synthesist (page 80) takes ability damage or drain while the eidolon is present?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Summoner: What happens when a synthesist (page 80) takes ability damage or drain while the eidolon is present?
sections.description: The eidolon takes Str, Dex, and Con damage or drain, the summoner takes Int, Wis, or Cha damage or drain. If this bring's the eidolon's Str or Dex...

sections.title: Summoner: What happens when a synthesist (page 80) takes a penalty, suffers an affliction, or has an ongoing effect when the eidolon disappears?
sections.anchor_heading: ## Summoner: What happens when a synthesist (page 80) takes a penalty, suffers an affliction, or has an ongoing effect when the eidolon disappears?
sections.description: These effects persist on the summoner after the eidolon is gone. For example, aray of enfeeblementon the fused character continues to affect the su...

sections.title: Witch, Ice Tomb Hex: What is the range of this hex? Can it affect objects? Does the target need to drink? Can it affect a cold-immune creature? If the target succeeds at its save, is it still imprisoned? How long does it last?

Like most major hexes, the range is 60 feet.
